title: Firefox crashes continuesly and constantly increased ram usage
content:
Dear support team,

It is a bit more than a week that firefox crashes sometimes almost every couple of minutes, even if using only one tab, no downloads and deactivating all extensions. It seems connected more to youtube, and I noticed recently that it constantly increases the use of RAM (up to 6-8 gb) which I am suspecting to be the cause here. Keep in mind my laptop has 16 gb RAM ddr4.

I have resetted Firefox as well, to no avail. Next step, which I really wanted to avoid, is to make a fresh install of firefox.

This is a crash report ID of the last days that I still can see:

44c6d9ef-8f3d-4072-93bb-31fadaffedb9 27/10/2022, 02:26

I added a screenshot of the current RAM use of firefox.

Do you know how I could fix this?

Thank you so much!
creator: carlotti.sebastian

title: Metamask error: MetaMask had trouble starting. This error could be intermittent, so try restarting the extension
content:
Hi, I am required to log in Metamask on Firefox, as this is my backup login, but I encounter the error in subject and did not find any solution on the web, as I don't want to re-install the add-on, because I need some keys stored in my current login.

Is there any solution to be able to log in the add on, without reinstalling it, please?

If I inspect the console, I have the following 2 errors:

Content Security Policy: The page’s settings blocked the loading of a resource at eval (“script-src”). moz-extension:9430:29

Uncaught (in promise) Error: An unexpected error occurred undefined

Im on MacOS Ventura. I tried restarting then reinstalling but I didnt get fixed. Please help
creator: Nerdronaut

title: Perda de conexão ao configurar pen modem Huawei
content:
Olá!

Após acessar o pagina de configuração do pen modem Huawei no navegador Mozilla Firefox for Fedora (versão 106.0.1 (64-bits)) ou qualquer outra versão anterior pois normalmente ocorre da página fechar e surgir a seguinte mensagem: sem conexão com a internet, exceto com o navegador Chrome do Google que eu consigo navegar nesta pagina. Trata-se de um localhost.

Eu gosto muito do Mozilla Firefox e, inclusive, é o navegador nativo do Fedora. Já o Chrome é classificado como potencialmente inseguro mas é só com o Chrome que eu consigo navegar e realizar as configurações desejadas sem falhas de carregamento entre uma aba e outra entre login e logout.

Desde já agradeço e coloco-me à disposição para informações adicionais e/ou complementares para normalizar esse assunto.

Atenciosamente,

Ricardo P.
creator: rhiccarddo

title: Trying to disable ad blocker
content: I want to disable ad blocker. I actually want to see the ads. Since I did the latest update, ad blocker is turned on, and there appears to be no way to turn it off. How do I disable it?
creator: egarris2

title: Firefox logo mostly covered by private browsing symbol.  Basically private browsing (mask) means Firefox now?
content:
Below I show screen shots of the blank page on firefox which has the firefox logo all but diminished under the private browsing mask. It's the same on the start bar but of course much smaller.

It makes it look like the new brand of firefox is the private browsing mask (I am always in that mode except for netflix).

I prefer the firefox logo and I surely don't need to know when I'm in private browsing on the start bar. The home page I don't care about, but I know I'm in private browsing cause the upper area of firefox says private browsing right on the browser itself. I have no idea why we would need be made aware that we're in private browsing, it seems the opposite would be more helpful.

I'm writing because I don't like this new firefox tiny icon with a big purple mask over it. Wanted to let you know.

If you're changing brands or something? To a purple mask? And private browsing isn't all that great.

The image on the left below is the new firefox icon on the start bar. The one on the right is on the blank page which I don't care about at all but it's just a bigger picture.

Who/what is firefox?

I love firefox, but just saying.

Thanks for hearing.
creator: g888

title: Access Denied pages
content: I have received access denied errors on a few webpages, one corrected when using a different browser and making sure tracking cookies were allowed. This is still happening even with Basic allowance of cookies, instead of strict.
creator: julie56

title: Book Mark history deletion
content: Is there a way to delete a bookmark from the book-mark drop-down window (accessed from triple horizontal bar/right side of browser) but retain the same book-mark that had been saved in a folder created in Other Bookmarks? I discovered that when you delete a book-mark entry from drop down menu, the same entry is also deleted from its saved location in Other Book Marks. I was trying to reduce number of unsorted entries in drop down menu while saving (and retaining) the same link in the Other Bookmarks section and folder. I want to continue using the sorting and discrete folder saving possible with the Other Bookmark section but clean up the clutter in the unsorted bookmark section.
creator: nokaoi1

title: website permissions
content: I denied permission to a website to access my camera and microphone on the top toolbar. How do I grant permission now to the websoite. I did not mean to deny permission every time I visited. I am also using another computer with windows 10pro and I am havin the same issue
creator: dalenortman

title: Make firefox respect communication and playback devices
content: Is there any way to make firefox respect default communication and playback devices? As it stands right now, if I wanna chat with friends on facebook then I have to go through Windows and force firefox to output audio to my headset, which means that if I wanna watch a video as well, the audio from that no longer comes from my sound system, but my headset instead. When seraching for 'audio,' 'sound,' or 'playback' in the settings (after going through them all manually) I can't seem to change that. Chrome did it just fine..
creator: gioserpo

title: bookmarks text white on white
content: Firefox updated to 106.0.2 (64-bit). When I press ctrl-B, my bookmarks appear on the browser's left side as expected. However the text is not visible. If I hover my mouse over an icon is the list for a bookmark, the link appears. Also not all the bookmark icons appear. There are gaps between bookmarks on the list. Again, I have to hover my mouse over those gaps for bookmark info to appear. How do I make my bookmark list readable/usable again?

I really don't want to have to install Chrome or reinstall Edge just to pay my cable bill.
